summary.p: Cantos (paṭalam) 1-12 of the Tēmpāvaṇi with the old commentary.

The mūlam of the Tēmpāvaṇi as it appears in this manuscript seems overall similar to that of the editio princeps, but there are some variations, especially in the pāyiram. The text of the commentary, on the other hand, seems to differ substantially in some cases (as in the commentary ad pāyiram 1 transcribed below), which would deserve further investigation.
The manuscript contains the following sections, marked by left-marginal intertitles:

collation.desc: 1 folio = Tēmpāvaṇi: Front Matter. No foliation.

302 folios = Tēmpāvaṇi: Paṭalam 1-12. Tamil foliation 1-90, 101-312. f91-f100 are missing. f23 is misplaced, and found between f38 and f39. BAM: Des numéros tracés à l'encre dans la marge gauche, accompagnés de petites ficelles placées dans le trou d'enfilage gauche, séparent douze parties : f. 1-6, f. 7-23, f. 24-38, f. 39-52, f. 53-66, f. 67-94, f. 95-114, f. 115-136, f. 137-165, f. 166-197, f. 198-235, f. 236-272, f. 273-302.

supportDesc.foliation: After the unnumbered front folios (U1, U2), 302 folios (U3) are foliated 1-302 in library Arabic foliation and 1-90, 101-312 in the original Tamil foliation, since folios 91-100 are missing. This is marked with Tamil numbers, likely put by the original scribe, on the left margin. Arabic numbers have been added later with a pencil on the right top corner of the leaves. Because of the missing folios, the Arabic foliation corresponds to the Tamil one in the beginning, but a discrepancy of 10 units begins after f90. The likely original Tamil foliation is taken here as reference.

handNote.desc: Hand #2. Partially inked (for instance, f263r, f283 to f312). While the manuscript is in the scriptio continua and uses the traditional spelling (i.e. no differentiation between long ē and short e) it contains some rare occurrences of puḷḷi on top of the letter ra (also in f1r1 transcribed below).

additions.desc: Left-marginal chapter (paṭalam titles. See list in the summary, above, and selection below. In-text preview of next chapter.
Light annotations in black ink throughout the manuscripts.

An unknown reader has marked chapter numbers (using Tamil numerals) below the titles that appear on the left margin of the folia at the beginning of each chapter. Most likely the same reader has marked verse 13 of chapter 8, by going over its number and circling it with ink (f151v). By mistake, he has dropped some ink on f237v, where he has also marked a passage, perhaps because it was interesting or relevant, with a wavy line on the right margin. These annotations might be part of a coherent set with the more explicit annotations found in BnF Indien 475 (the second part of this multi-volume manuscript) that include dates, and might reflect one reading session.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Not dated by Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-) nor by Cabaton (1912). Not after 1854, since part of the collection of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854), bequested in 1855 to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868).

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
